rev.diff:
Line 7: Line 7:
After a fight with the producer, Captain Hollywood left and created [[Captain Hollywood Project]], another successful Eurodance act. The project remained dormant until [[1993]], when [[Stay C]] joined in. In late summer, a new single, ''Slave to the Music'', was launched. It charted all around Europe, being the first dance record to get platinum in ex-Czechoslovakia.
After a fight with the producer, Captain Hollywood left and created [[Captain Hollywood Project]], another successful Eurodance act. The project remained dormant until [[1993]], when [[Stay C]] joined in. In late summer, a new single, ''Slave to the Music'', was launched. It charted all around Europe, being the first dance record to get platinum in ex-Czechoslovakia.
â
The following singles, ''Is It Love'' and ''Take Me Away'', peaked #5 in Israel and Twenty 4 Seven became the most important dance act at that time. It was known worldwide, except America and UK. They played even in South Africa. The single ''Leave Them Alone'' included a ''Greatest Hits Megamix''.
+
The following singles, ''Is It Love'' and ''Take Me Away'', peaked #5 in Israel. It was known worldwide, except America and UK. They played even in South Africa. The single ''Leave Them Alone'' included a ''Greatest Hits Megamix''.
But although their contract was on until 1996, they didn't release anything. Nance declared that the group is practically split due to personal issues. Stella, an experienced singer, who already toured with [[Captain Hollywood]], replaced Nance, who focused on her solo career. During the 1996 summer, both Nance's ''Big Brother Is Watching You'' and the Twenty 4 Seven's ''We Are The World'' were very popular in The Netherlands.
But although their contract was on until 1996, they didn't release anything. Nance declared that the group is practically split due to personal issues. Stella, an experienced singer, who already toured with [[Captain Hollywood]], replaced Nance, who focused on her solo career. During the 1996 summer, both Nance's ''Big Brother Is Watching You'' and the Twenty 4 Seven's ''We Are The World'' were very popular in The Netherlands.
